ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, guys! Sorry if I ve been slow in participating in the discussions -- I was sick recently and let all my e-mail pile up, and I m just now getting through
ygData.rawEmail:
X-Digest-Num: 14
Message-ID: <17248.14.37.959279670@...>
Date: Wed, 10 Feb 1999 22:55:25 -0500
From: Tom Ricket <tricket@...>
Subject: Assorted things


Hi, guys!

Sorry if I've been slow in participating in the discussions -- I was sick
recently and let all my e-mail pile up, and I'm just now getting through it.

Personally, I think the idea of a levels page is great! I have to admit that
I've got several sets of levels submitted to us that I've been supposed to look
at and, if they pass muster, put on our page, and I just haven't had the time
recently to do this :( If I can hand off the responsibility to anyone out
there, you can bet I'd be happy to do it! :> And of course we'd be happy to
link to the page from the main Gladiator page.

The idea of a tournament sounded interesting as well, although it might be a
lot of work. The biggest problem would probably be to make sure there was no
cheating involved, which might mean using an honor system, or might require us
to try to make a special version of the executable .. hmm .. I'd have to think
about that. Even with a special version of the exe, you'd still have people who
would use bugs that we haven't yet worked out (using a healer and thief in
tandem, etc.) to gain experience.

 From David Storey:
>I would also like to point out that when I last checked the "boost"
>program you have available for download it outdated, it modifies the
>wrong locations in the file (I mucked around a bit and found some of
>the useful Hex locations, but I can't write a replacement program).

Whoops; that's my fault. The author of Boost (not myself) had asked me to let
him know when or if we changed the file format, and I didn't do that .. and so
yes, it's most likely doing some very STRANGE things now! I'll get in contact
with him, and see if he wants to update it, or if not, let me have the source
so I could change it quickly on our end.

Next topic:
>Also, I noticed there was a graphics editor included w/ the game.  Anyone 
>ever tried creating new monsters?  Is it possible, or can you only modify 
>existing creatures?

The graphics editor (editor.exe) was the initial (very crude, I admit) sprite
editor that we made for Gladiator. While it's possible to modify existing
graphics (either background art, or the characters and monsters), you can't
actually ADD anything, because we have that hard-coded into the game. So you
could, for example, make a better looking elf, or something similar, but you
couldn't add a new character type to the game.

 From Jeff:
>you can change what things look like. I edited a cleric once. I made it
>have a yellow ball on top of its staff

Speaking of which, if enough aspiring artists out there ever do want to play
with the editor and make different graphics for characters or backgrounds,
etc., that's another thing we could try to conglomerate into an "alternate
graphics package" if anyone's interested.

--Tom
